title: Firefox randomly shows blank screens when connected to OpenVPN
content:
Hi,

We are experiencing a weird and difficult to troubleshoot issue. When freshly started Firefox sessions start without the VPN being active, everything runs smooth. When we active the VPN to connect to our own network, it still runs for 99% but will randomly show a blank page when opening a link or a new tab. When this occurs, there is no way to open Firefox's internal tools for troubleshooting, it looks like the tab just crashes. Firefox does still work though because if we keep clicking the link or keep opening new tabs, there will be a tab that becomes responsive again eventually. But the quicker workaround at the moment is to close Firefox completely and open it up again after the processes have been shut down as well. The issue doesn't return until the laptop is rebooted and Firefox is started before the VPN was started. The issue is not reproducible in any other browser. We are using the latest version of OpenVPN and Firefox 102.2.0ESR. We have not found anyone online that has had the same issues so I hope some of you can point me in the right direction to resolve this issue. Thanks.
creator: jasperbohm

creator: jimrick10

title: Cannot close suspect tab from vpn-guard.org on iphone
content:
How can I close a tab when the site puts up a dialogue?

My wife, without knowing how, opened a tab in Firefox on her iPhone with a URL starting vpn-guard.org/version, and this tab put up a dialog asking her to upgrade vpn-guard with OK being the only option; other controls such as the menu, back arrow, tab list did not respond.

Since she does not use a VPN and I could find very little information about the domain, it seemed highly suspect. We therefore wanted to close this tab, but since the other controls were inactive this seemed impossible. We tried closing and restarting Firefox, and restarting the iPhone, neither of which helped. In the end all I could think of was to re-install Firefox, which of course did work.

Could we have done this better?
creator: PJTraill

title: Lector PDF
content: En un archivo PDF rellenable hay un campo fecha que pone el día de hoy con una coma y dos ceros. En otros lectores de PDF no ocurre y se trunca el campo fecha a número entero sin decimales.
creator: garcia.villamil

title: Can't change password or delete firefox sync account
content:
I've logged into my firefox sync account ok, but it then won't let me change my old password. I tried deleting my sync account so I can start again but it won't let me do that either. Although I logged in ok (so the password must be correct!), for both of the above it says my current pasword is wrong!

I've tried deleting a secondary email address (as I no longer use it), using 'private window' mode, 'Troubleshooting mode', and I've also turned off AVG just in case that was interfering, but I still get the same error.

I want to change my password as it's 8yrs old and I'm setting up a new install of Win 10. I don't care if I lose anything currently saved on firefox sync as I have a local copy.

Please help. thanks.
creator: general_david

title: Logins and Passwords Formatting Lost
content:
All my logins that had a numeric only user number have lost their formatting - such as HMRC.

So where it should be a 12 digit number it is now showing :- 8.99003E+11

I can no longer login to any of my accounts that have numerical only user names.

I also hasten to add that this is a lot older than the shown august date for last month.

title: How to add a security exception to a specific port via cmd.
content: Is it possible to add a security exception to a specific port via the cmd console? I know, i can do this in about:config and add string in network.security.ports.banned.override but I need to add this port via command line. Thanks very much in advance for any hints.

title: Configuração de impressão, acrescentar uma nova impressora
content: Quando quero imprimir qualquer coisa do firefox (site, arquivo pdf) a única opção que aparece para impressão é salvar em pdf. Nem sempre foi assim. A versão atual é 104.0.2 (64-bit) Mozilla Firefox Snap for Ubuntu canonical-002-1.0. Procurei na internet mas não achei como habilitar também a impressora. Não quero deixar de ter a opção de destino "salvar como pdf", e sim ter a opção de também imprimir com a impressora. Atualmente após "imprimir" qualquer arquivo pelo firefox tenho que abrir com o meu leitor de pdf (foxit) para então poder usar a impressora. Alguém poderia me dizer como configurar a impressão pela impressora no firefox? Grata

title: Error Code  “SSL_ERROR_RX_RECORD_TOO_LONG”
content:
I have no trouble logging into my NAS except the address is only http, However, when I log into my NAS I get a message telling me the website I am going to is unsecure and I should go to a private secure website. However, when I click on the private option I get the following code... “SSL_ERROR_RX_RECORD_TOO_LONG” .

I want to make my NAS IP address https rather than http as I was hacked last year and lost all my music files (over 200 cd's) from my NAS. It has taken me 5 months to re-copy all my music onto my NAS so as you can appreciate I am very warey about not having a secure https site address.


Can anyone please help?

Many thanks
creator: Pompeyexile

title: Sandboxed Iframe allows download without dowloads being enabled
content: I recently noticed that a sandboxed iframe without the 'allow downloads' flags set still automatically downloads files when the src of the iframe is set to an url that triggers a download (e.g. https://download.mozilla.org/?product=firefox-stub&os=win&lang=en-US). This is not the behaviour I would expect but I can't find any information about this specific case in the documentation. Can someone tell me if this is intended behaviour, a bug or a grey zone in the HTML specification.
